intro: Dissochaeta alstonii, commonly known as the alstonii hairvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Dissochaeta alstonii is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, which makes it an important plant in soil enrichment. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it a notable species in its native range.
